data.title: New Horizons Finds Nitrogen Glaciers and Hazy Air on Pluto: Astronomers astounded by the dwarf planet's active geology and atmosphere

Mexico poverty rate hit 46.2% last year as 2 million more join ranks of poor.The poverty rate increased by 0.7 percentage point to 46.2 percent last year from 45.5 percent in 2012, equivalent to 55.3 million people in the nation of nearly 120 million
Barack Obama tells African states to abandon anti-gay discrimination
Cannabis petition forces MPs to consider debating legalisation: More than 100,000 sign appeal calling for total legalisation hosted on government’s official e-petitions website.

An independent Mexican commission said on Thursday it found serious flaws in an investigation into the apparent massacre of 43 students last year, dealing a fresh blow to President Enrique Pena Nieto over a scandal that has battered his administration.
Human Traffickers Arrested at Delhi Airport; 21 Nepalese Girls Rescued
Approximately 80 percent of Mongolia’s crops have died this summer due to extreme drought across the country

Pakistan Tried to Create 'World's Most Powerful Surveillance System' by Illegally Tapping Undersea Internet Cables. The report by Privacy International found that ISI was being provided spying tools by companies such as Atis (Germany), Ericsson (Sweden), Nokia and Huawei
House prices pushed up by foreign gangsters: Investigators warn the London property market is being "skewed" by international criminals seeking to hide their ill-gotten gains.
ISIS has abducted 182 children in the Iraqi city of Mosul to train them as militants & use them as suicide bombers
